isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - HEATING, VENTILATION, AND AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC) TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - HEATER AND AIR CONDITIONER (CAB) - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: Does the blower run in either the low, medium, or high speed position?
Remove heater control relay (463)/R5, move key switch to ignition position, and at circuit 13AK measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13AK or 13H, then repair.
At relay socket (463)/R5, measure voltage from circuit 13AK to 13-GT.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 13-GT, 77-G, 58-GA, or 11-G to right dash panel ground, then repair.
AT (B2) battery stud, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage at (B2) battery stud, then repair.
Remove fuse F1-C and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At F1-C circuit 14Z, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14H or 14Z, then repair.
Re-install fuse F1-C and at relay socket (463)/R5, measure voltage from circuit 75A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75A, then repair.
Bench test heater control relay (463)/R5 by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test heater control relay (463)/R5 by applying +12 volts to pin 86, ground to pin 85, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install (463)/R5 and disconnect switch (11). Move key switch to ignition position and at (11) circuit 75B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75B, then repair.
Test blower control switch (11) by placing switch in low position, and measuring resistance from switch terminal B to L and B to A/C.
(11), term. B to L and B to A/C.
Test blower control switch (11) by placing switch in medium position, and measuring resistance from switch terminal B to L, B to M, and B to A/C.
(11), term. B to L, B to M, and B to A/C.
Test blower control switch (11) by placing switch in high position, and measuring resistance from switch terminal B to H, B to M, and B to A/C.
(11), term. B to H, B to M, and B to A/C.
Re-install blower switch (11). Move key switch to on position. Does blower motor run at low speed when blower switch is set to low position?
Disconnect connector (162) and with key switch in ignition position and blower switch in low speed position, measure voltage from circuit 75C [coming from (11)] to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75C, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (162) and disconnect resistor and thermo fuse assembly (27). With key switch in ignition position and blower switch in low position, measure voltage from circuit 75C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75C, then repair.
At blower resistor and thermo fuse assy. (27), measure resistance from terminal 1 to 2.
At blower resistor and thermo fuse assy. (27), measure resistance from terminal 2 to 3.

Reconnect blower resistor, and disconnect connector (161). With key switch in ignition position and blower switch in low speed position, at (161) circuit 75T [coming from (27)], measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75T, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (161) and remove high speed relay (462)/R2. At circuit 75T, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75T, then repair.
Bench test high speed relay (462)/R2 by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test high speed relay (462)/R2 by applying +12 volts to pin 86, ground to pin 85, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Move key switch to ignition position, blower switch to high speed position, and at (462)/R2 circuit 75H, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75H, then repair.
With switches still set, at (462)/R2 measure voltage from circuit 75H to 75-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 75-GB, 75-GC, 50-GB or 11-G to right dash panel gnd., then repair.
At (462)/R2 install a test jumper from circuit 75F to 75-GB. Disconnect conn. (161) and at circuit 75F [coming from (462)/R2], measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 75F, then repair.
At conn. (161) measure resistance from circuit 75-G [going to right dash panel] to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 75-G or 11-G to cab ground stud, then repair.
Reconnect (161) and disconnect circuit 75F from blower motor. Move key switch to ignition position, blower switch to low speed position, and at circuit 75F, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75F, then repair.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 75-G, then repair.
With ignition key in off position, reconnect circuit 75F. Move key switch to ignition position and with blower switch in low speed position, does blower run?
Remove medium speed relay (462)/R3, move key switch to ignition position and blower switch to medium speed position. At cir. 75N, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75N, then repair.
With switches still set, at (462)/R3 measure voltage from circuit 75N to 75-GC.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 75-GC, 50-GB, or 11-G to right dash panel gnd. stud, then repair.
At relay socket (462)/R3 and circuit 75D, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75D, then repair.
Bench test medium speed relay (462)/R3 by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test medium speed relay (462)/R3 by applying +12 volts to pin 86, ground to pin 85, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.

Disconnect conn. (161), re-install medium speed relay (462)/R3, move key switch to ignition position and blower switch to low speed position. At (161) circuit 75M [coming from (462)/R3], measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75M, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (27) and reconnect conn. (161). At (27) circuit 75M, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75M, then repair.
Remove fuse F1-A and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Replace fuse F1-A, and at circuit 14X, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14X, then repair.
Reconnect (27) and remove high speed relay (462)/R2. At (462)/R2 circuit 75, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75, then repair.
Re-install high speed relay (462)/R2. Heater blower circuits check good.
See Section 1.3.1 for troubleshooting of blower system.
Disconnect A/C switch conn. (904), move key switch to ignition position, and move blower switch to low position. At (904) measure voltage from circuit 77 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 77 or blower switch, then repair.
With switches still on, at connector (904), measure voltage from circuit 77 to 77-GK.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 77-GK or 11-GB to left cab ground (429), then repair.
Bench test switch (904) by measuring resistance from term. A to B with switch in on position. NOTE: Place "+" lead on term. A.
Reconnect switch (904). Does A/C switch (904) indicator function?
Remove A/C control relay (144). With key switch in ignition position, and blower switch in low position, at (144) circuit 77K measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 77K or 77S, then repair.
At (144), with switches still set, measure voltage from circuit 77K to 77-GS.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 77-GS, 82-GA, 12-GF, 11-GQ, or 11-GF to left dash panel ground stud, then repair.
Remove fuse F1-B and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F1-B, and at circuit 14Z, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14Z or 14H from (B2) batt. stud, then repair.
At (144) circuit 77T, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 77T, then repair.
Bench test A/C control relay (144) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test A/C control relay (144) by applying +12 volts to pin 86, ground to pin 85, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.

Re-install A/C control relay (144) and disconnect conn. (162). Set A/C switch (904) to on, blower switch (11) to low, and key switch to ignition position. At (162) cir. 77H, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 77H, then repair.
At conn. (162) (going to heater box), measure resistance from circuit 77B to 77F (evaporator temperature must be greater than 34°F).
Disconnect thermostatic switch (N/L), and measure resistance from terminal 1 to 2 (evaporator temperature must be greater than 34°F).
At connector (N/L), removed from thermostatic switch, and circuit 77B, install a jumper wire to gnd. At connector (162) circuit 77B, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 77B, then repair.
At conn. (N/L), removed from thermostatic switch and circuit 77F, install a jumper wire to ground. At conn. (162) circuit 77F, going to heater box, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 77F, then repair.

With thermostatic switch (N/L) and conn. (162) reconnected, remove A/C relay (463)/R6. Move key switch to ignition position, A/C switch (904) to on, and blower switch (11) to low. At (463)/R6 circuit 77F, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 77F, then repair.
With switches still set, at relay socket (463)/R6, measure voltage from circuit 77F to 77-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 77-G, 58-GA, or 11-G to right dash panel gnd. stud, then repair.
At relay socket (463)/R6 measure resistance of cir. 77D (terminal that relay pin 86 was in, to term. that relay pin 87 was in).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 77D, then repair.
At relay socket (463)/R6 install jumper wire from circuit 77F to 77C. Set A/C switch (904) to on, blower switch (11) to low, and key switch to ignition position. Did A/C clutch engage (click once)?
With switches still set, disconnect connector (2) and at circuit 77C [coming from (463)/R6] measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 77C, then repair.
With switches still set, reconnect conn. (2) and disconnect compressor connector (N/L). At (N/L) circuit 77C measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 77C, then repair.
With switches still set, reconnect conn. (N/L) at the A/C compressor clutch. Does the clutch engage (click once)?
With switches still set, disconnect low pressure safety switch (N/L), and measure voltage from circuit 77E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 77C or 77E, then repair.
With switches still set, disconnect high pressure safety switch (N/L), and measure voltage from circuit 77N to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 77N, then repair.

At relay socket (463)/R6 move jumper wire to between circuit 77F and 77R. Move key switch to ignition position, A/C switch (904) to on, and blower switch (11) to low. At low pressure safety switch (N/L) circuit 77P, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 77R or 77P, then repair.
At high pressure safety switch (N/L) circuit 77J, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 77J, then repair.
Measure resistance of low pressure safety switch (N/L).
If refrigerant charge is within limits, replace defective low pressure switch.
Measure resistance of high pressure safety switch (N/L).
If refrigerant charge is within limits, replace defective high pressure switch.
Bench test A/C relay (463)/R6 by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test A/C relay (463)/R6 by applying +12 volts to terminal 85, ground to terminal 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Air conditioner circuits check good. Remove test jumper, re-install relay, and reconnect the separated connectors.
